author: Novelty
title: Green Ninjas and a Lord
review: This is basically three minifigs with a sword on the stand.  It was a limited release of sorts and so is rather rare.  There's almost no building involved in this set.  Unlike the other 2 sets though, this is the only set with green ninjas and is the only way to obtain the green ninjas.

author: BobaFett2
title: A great way to get a Samurai
review:
I got this set in 2000, and ended up losing not only the samurai's helmet, but also a ninja and two swords. Due to the miracle of Bricklink, I have more ninja and samurai. Sadly, both the arms and torso of the Samurai are cracked (this keeps happening to me! I have brand new minifigures whose hands/arms have never been removed yes have cracked arms).

Box/Instructions

The box has nice little scene displaying all the minifigures on the stands as well as the ninja and samurai in the center. At the bottom and top there's Mini Heroes Collection, and it lists the set number, age, and what pack number it is.

Parts

The three stands are quite interesting. They have Ninja on them right in front of the minifigure. They can be placed on other parts.

Minifigures

Awesome. The Samurai is really cool-his leg prints, torso prints, sword, and helmet are great. The "horn-like thing" is also very nice. The Ninjas are also good-but I prefer the Samurai.

The completed model

Three minifigures on stands, with information cards (all lost by now). Suitable for display.

Summary

The set was a nice little impulse at the time, along with the other minifigure collections. I found that the base makes for a nice statue base. This set is nice for the minifigures, probably one of the cheapest ways to get three Ninja minifigures.
